intro: Mariscus nyasensis, commonly known as the Nyasaland marshmallow, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, fleshy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in wet, marshy areas and is adapted to humid, tropical climates. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
